summary: Email correspondence between Assistant United States Attorneys in the Southern District of New York discussing scheduling a meeting to address a forfeiture question related to a property in the Jeffrey Epstein case. The email exchange shows coordination on legal strategy regarding asset forfeiture.

persons.name: Ted
persons.context: Mentioned as being available to discuss a forfeiture question related to the Jeffrey Epstein case along with the email author.

persons.name: Judge Sullivan
persons.context: Mentioned as having a scheduled appointment with the email author at 4 PM on June 28, 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case for which a property forfeiture question is being discussed.

connections.description: Ted, as an Assistant United States Attorney, is involved in the legal case against Jeffrey Epstein, specifically regarding property forfeiture.

events.title: Forfeiture Discussion Scheduling
events.description: Assistant United States Attorneys coordinate to schedule a meeting to discuss a forfeiture question related to a property in the Jeffrey Epstein case.

keyFacts: Prosecutors in the Southern District of New York were actively working on property forfeiture matters related to the Jeffrey Epstein case in June 2019.
The email exchange shows coordination between Assistant United States Attorneys regarding legal strategy on asset forfeiture.
The document references a specific property that authorities were hoping to forfeit in connection with the Epstein case.
